intro: Lasianthus bokorensis, commonly known as the Bokorensis mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species within its genus.
